definition: broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: He's found out about the ruse, but his demands for an apartment haven't wavered.
sentences.chinese: 張炘煬識破了這個花招，沒有動搖自己的主張。

sentences.english: Since they are better able to detect them, they have to worry less about being duped.
sentences.chinese: 自從他們又能力識破謊言以來，他們就很少擔心被騙。

sentences.english: You made a point, and I get it. Now give It back.
sentences.chinese: 我識破你的小把戲了，把它交出來。

sentences.english: The devil trick is seen all of a sudden through.
sentences.chinese: 魔鬼的鬼計一下子就被識破。

sentences.english: Nobody saw through his disguise,but his accent gave him away.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人識破他的僞裝，但是他的口音暴露了自己。

sentences.english: I finally wised up  to his tricks.
sentences.chinese: 我最後識破了他的詭計。

sentences.english: Many fake the real thing, merchants can not see through at once.
sentences.chinese: 許多假貨可以亂真，商家無法一下子識破。

sentences.english: The police has wised up their game.
sentences.chinese: 警察識破了他們的鬼把戲。

sentences.english: I've got wise to his tricks, he can't cheat me any more.
sentences.chinese: 我已經識破了他的詭計，他再也騙不了我了。

sentences.english: You'll be onto his tricks soon.
sentences.chinese: 你很快就會識破他的詭計。

sentences.english: Research shows the average person barely does any better than chance.
sentences.chinese: 研究顯示，一般人識破謊言的本事不比碰運氣強多少。

sentences.english: Children will soon see through empty praise.
sentences.chinese: 記住，孩子馬上就能識破誇大其辭的讚揚。

sentences.english: The spy doesn't know we have him pegged.
sentences.chinese: 那個間諜不知道我們已經把他識破了。

sentences.english: Mr He eight see through the counsel of the keyboard, command set.
sentences.chinese: 賀老八識破了李劍的計謀，命令手下放火。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, it came to pass that Jean Valjean sometimes espied him.
sentences.chinese: 但是有時候，冉阿讓仍識破了他。

sentences.english: so when you place the mouse in the tank it cannot see through.
sentences.chinese: 所以當您將水箱中的鼠標不能識破。

definition: to recognize people (of babies)/to be able to tell people apart
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over
to come to sb's door/to call on sb
to handle/to deal with/to cope/to get by with
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
